titleInfo.title: John B. Brownlow in Washington, D.C. to O.P. Temple

subject.geographic: The Development of the Industrial United States (1870-1900).

subject.topic: canvass; disenfranchisement; documents; ex-Confederates; information; law; letters; newspaper; newspaper files; political influence; radical; rebels.

subject.geographic: Columbia; North Carolina; Washington, DC; South.

subject.topic: Amherst College; Arnell, Samuel Mayes; Brownlow, J. B.; Congress; Johnson, Andrew; Maynard, Horace; Thomas, George H.; KuKlux; KuKlux Clan;.

mods.note: Arnell and his projected history of Tennessee 1860-70; material for book given by Brownlow; full credit to be given Temple and Nelson for Union leadership; report on interview with Bell wanted from Temple for the book.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.
